text: I stopped here the other day for some post-work Mexican food, and it is always great. I have eaten here two or three times, and have always been satisfied. I usually get the suizo burrito with steak. The portions are great, the burritos are always hot and well seasoned, and the service is on par with what you would expect from a place like this. I am not a fan of card minimums in toady's day and age (9 dollars), but besides that this restaurant is a good choice.

Once again, my journey for tacos led me here. Since I always see how popular it is with the drunk folks, I wanted to check if it was legitimately good. Went. Grabbed a couple of tacos. Chicken of course. ................. ....................... I think it's better if you're drunk  ‍
Terrible tacos! The lengua was tough, almost inedible and disgusting. The service was slow and I realize they are at times but their slowness was ridiculous.

The nacho plate with chicken is totally a gut buster, and seriously the epitome of Americanized Mexican. This restaurant is soooooo much the 2am spot. But! But, I'm not gonna lie... I was loving those nachos! If I want some sloppy gut busting food I'll be back to this spot with the quickness

I live in the area and, actually, closer to another Mexican restaurant that has the same quality of food that costs more. Taco & Burrito Palace is a gem in the neighborhood. The aesthetic of the restaurant is "hole in the wall". There are a few fast food style booth tables, a counter at the window with stools, and that's about it. That's all you need though because let's face it: you're here for some cost effective but delicious food, which, if you're a fan of Mexican food, you'll get. You go up to the counter, take a look at the menu (which is fairly extensive), and order. Don't let your social anxiety get in the way as the staff is very friendly and patient. I ordered a suizo burrito dinner, which included a burrito, beans, and rice with a few chips and veggies on the side. You can pick your fillings. I chose ground beef as my filling. The service was pretty fast and very friendly. They make everything to order, and you go up to the counter when they call your name, which was a nice touch (I didn't tell them my name, but they saw it on my credit card...so that was a pleasant surprise that was endearing). They offer up some refrigerated sauces- verde, hot sauce, etc. I chose the verde. The total cost for my "dinner" meal and a drink was only $11.50 with a tip ($9.50) before. This is a steal in the area. The price and quality match for once! I wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but the fact that it is right near my apartment and affordable makes it a sort of "diamond in the rough". I will definitely be back here.

Not perfect but 5 stars to me = worth the price. I'll never forget the Twon from Men On Film walking out one afternoon with his carryout order....at the door.... "Wait. Waits.  What's in this burrito?  Does it have beans?" "Yes." "Wells I done no want no beans." "It'll be  $3.00 to take them off." (Decides he/she/whatever will scrape off the beans and sashays off to "restorative justice" class at COH clutching it's pearly white plastic  bag)  LOL.  Go complain to the cook at Harold's in Englewood that you thought the fried chicken was gluten free and free range. "Two snaps up" for Jose! P.S. Don't go there after 1:45am.  This is when the "last call" people at Lil Jimbo's get scared, flee and decide they want a burrito or #3......which  is healthier and safer but it gets really messy (picture Weiner's Circle but with some Chanel No. 5, pine tree car air freshener and hot tub chlorine strewn about to whet your appetite - what a movie - "Hated it!" ).  Also, my co-workers husband got gay bashed outside this palace and he's not even gay.  I could just imagine what HE said. And to those complaining there's no restroom there. They let me use the one you have to walk through the kitchen to get to.  Maybe it's because I didn't have an air of "entitlement" about me or wasn't waving a knife.  Also, all looked good back there.

Good spot for fast tacos. This is maybe one or two minutes from my apartment. When I'm craving tacos I just grab them from here. I usually only get steak tacos with cilantro, onion and cheese. I get sour cream on the side. I've walked in to order before and called ahead as well (generally during random/off hours). I'm pretty set with just two tacos. Three = too many. I think they are cash only up to $9. You can use card $9+  This place is also a popular late night drunk food spot. I only ate inside once with some friends when it was crowded and after 11pm. Otherwise I just get it to go!
My go to for burritos for over 20 years. Same guys running the place. Definitely best burrito place around, the salsa is the best anywhere.

Twice now I've ordered the chicken tacos, both times sober. Great heap of hot shredded chicken with lettuce, tomato, cheese and sour cream wrapped in two tortillas. I needed a fork to finish it off. Go with the salsa verde - At $2.50/taco it's a great way to pad the tummy before or after a night out. As well as all the t & bs they also, strange as it is, offer hamburgers and fries!!
Good burritos, but overcharged my card. Never visiting this place again. That dollar and fourteen cents probably wasnt worth losing my business.
Reliably and consistently good. I order here all the time. i love the tacos here. It is fast and delicious.

I live right across the street and it took me a whole year to check them out and now that I did I have become a fan, that I am there 3-4 times a month. Try their Al-pastor tortas, they are delicious. Great price too!
Can't go wrong at the Palace. Drunk, sober or anywhere in between - this is what you'll crave when you're nearby.

Taco and Burrito Palace is a great spot for authentic style Mexican cuisine. The pastor tacos are delicious and come standard on corn tortillas which I love. I also tried the chicken on a pita which was a nice twist. Tacos have a gratuitous amount of meat and toppings! Happy eating! PSA - this place is cash only unless you spend more than $9 but they have an ATM inside which is convenient.

WARNING: This place only takes cash unless you are paying with a card and you're total is over $9+.  We had to go back to the car to get cash because of this. The joint has an ATM however it costs you money so you are better off just bringing cash if you want to try this place out. They have lots of options and are open late which seems to work out quite well for this area. Everything seemed fresh and everyone that was a local raved about the food here and said you couldn't go wrong no matter what you ordered from here.
Your average go to spot for drunk eats. Don't get me wrong, it was great and hit the spot, but nothing noteable. They charge you for extra sour cream...I guess that makes sense...but not really.

The things I hate about this place. You don't order at the table which is not a big deal but you have to serve yourself? If you have kids with you, kind of stinks that you have to go up and grab 4 plates and get your own drinks, and find a table that's clean. I did see them clean them eventually. Also there is no restroom.  The food was ok. For $7 you'd expect a decent size burrito, not some dainty as* burrito. I've has better Mexican on the Northwest side. Very disappointing.
This is the rudest place on halsted, horrible customer service, they talk shit about you in Spanish thinking that you don't know Spanish and try to til u off

I think i'm switching my go-to order here now to tostadas as opposed to burritos and tacos(ironic given the name of the restaurant). Having only heard of this place in legend(and having only been to TBP #2 in the past), the opportunity to come here could not be passed up on a fated Friday night. This remains still in the top 5 decisions of my life; Al pastor tostada topped with avocado is one of the best things I've ever had; and at only $3 a pop is pretty filling when you order a few of them. Now granted, I may have been slightly non-sober at the time, but having been to TBP #2 when sober(and seeing as the menu and the food looks the exact same), I imagine that it's just as good during the other 15 hours of the day(and not just 3am).

Cheap, simple and open late! Visited late on a Friday and was happy with the service and the yummy food. I got a vegetarian burrito (warning that they make it on the same griddle as all the meat so don't come here if you're a strict vegetarian/vegan), it was great. The ingredients seemed really fresh and the tortilla was perfection. My boyfriend got the chorizo torta and raved about it. The bill totaled about $10- definitely check this out if you're out late in boystown!

Yes. If you've read my review of Zaragoza Mexican Deli & Grocery in NYC, you know that I have a strong sentimental attachment to good burritos made in really sketchy places. I thought that after leaving NYC and moving to Chicago, it would be very hard to replace the Zaragoza-sized hole left in my heart, but I walked a half a block from my new apartment and found this.  I was a big fan of Taco Burrito Palace #2 down near DePaul when I lived there last year (It's better than Allende, I'll fight you on this.), so having this back near me is great.  Go after 11 PM for the authentic experience. A Carne Asada Burrito Supreme is probably the call in terms of what's classic here. However, I mean, it's not actually that good, or, really, better than all of the other Chicago burrito shacks. I also once got a torta al pastor with avocado for lunch (while sober!) one day, and it was actually really good. I really love shifty burritos. Very sentimental.
Ate here last night and as always my steak tacos were excellent. My only grip was that the place had no air conditioning on and it was easily 95 degrees in their.

When hit by late-night hunger pangs at the intersection of Lakeview and Boystown--yes, sober people crave shitty Mexican after midnight, too--you don't really have any options other than Taco & Burrtio Palace... which is unfortunate because the food is as underwhelming as the last Ben Affleck movie.  After reading previous reviews, I decided to go with the super steak burrito because everyone else seemed to like it, and how hard is it to fuck up a steak burrito? Welp, the super steak burrito was about as super as Batman in that it was completely average and perfected over years of repetition.  Where were the tomatoes? Where was the sour cream? What about the beans? Was there really a point in putting three pieces of wilted lettuce in a burrito? Why was the steak so damn chewy? There aren't a ton of great values in the area for just over $7, but you'd probably expect your $7 investment to be a little more super than 5" of burrito you can finish off in seven bites. At more than a dollar per bite, I expected something far more, well, super. Was this purchase something I have buyer's remorse about? Not really. Was the food I received on the higher end of average? Probably. Would I spend over $7 on an average, super burrito from Taco & Burrito Palace ever again? Nope. You'll get three times as much food for the same amount of money from Subway, the tamale guy or even the 7-11 at the corner.

Twenty years ago I set foot in TBP for the very first time. The best steak burrito on earth, period. Just as good at noon as it at 4am.  There is a reason there is a line out the door on a saturday night.   I have spent years trying burritos across the US trying to find anything in comparison, and even though I have come across some good ones, nothing compares. Hugo is back and running the place again, and despite a move down the street and upgrade in ambiance, he and his crew have restored the quality of food to what I fell in love with years ago. My wife and I will make a special trip back to the city a couple times of year with the kids for the best food ever....and the best part is we will run into other young families we know doing the same exact thing!
I loved the "elote en palo" special the cute cashier gave me in the bathroom. Will be coming back more often for sure.

This is a great taco place!  Good prices, fast service and smiling faces.  I live just a block over and am super happy that I can just walk over to get some great steak tacos.  The Chorizo tacos are also very good.  If you want a good simple taco, everything else in the area is so overpriced and overrated and charge for the "atmosphere". This place keeps it simple and to the point; it's a taco joint and it's awesome!!!
I ordered the beef burrito. So yummy and quite a large portion for $8.49. Gotta love greasy food right after yoga!

Ohhhh, how I miss this place. I want to make special trip to Chicago just to eat here.  We lived within walking distance of this fabulous little Lakeview gem.  You can't beat the burritos at this fast food grill.
Good "stick to your ribs" Mexican food!  I usually get the Burrito Suizo dinner or Chorizo Torta.

The food is great for its price. But the service is what gets the 5 stars ! I always order a veg burrito with extra avocado, delicious late night craving. The staff is always friendly and nice. Love how attentive they are to the returning customer. Thank you guys !
My favorite late night tacos. Been going there so long/often that they know me & my order by heart. :)

I got three tacos here for takeout on a Saturday afternoon. I got one ground beef and two sirloin. These were quite possibly the best tacos I have ever had in my life. They are served in two corn tortillas, which are soft and fluffy. The meat was extremely flavorful and the toppings were fresh. They also give little containers of green salsa which is really good, and pretty spicy.  This restaurant is a 3 minute walk from my apartment, so I'll definitely be going more often.  Prices are really reasonable, too!  Cashier was really friendly, and I had a great experience.

Overall: I don't love the place, but it serves its purpose as decent late night Mexican food. Cash only. I awkwardly walked out the first time. Came back with cash the second time and got a greasy meaty quesadilla. Food: Steak quesadilla. I knew it was drunk the moment I saw them make it. It was greasy and it didn't have veggies. The tortilla wasn't too big but it was packed with beef and cheese. I should have identified that this was a drunk food place the moment I walked in. It's a hole-in-the-wall Mexican place that is located next to a bunch of bars off North Halsted. They are really strict on their cash only policy. They have a debit card machine but will only allow you to use a card if you spend 8 dollars more on food.  I know that the only trips I will make in the future is a fat end to a good night.

It's still quick, still simple and when done right still good. The only thing is they've been getting my order wrong a bit more often. They've added ingredients or not subtracted things I told them to leave off. There was also one time they gave me a flimsy bag that ripped open at the bottom, spilling my food anywhere. They're not bad in general, but sometimes they let you down.

This is not just amazing "drunk food" it's amazing period. Before discovering this place I would go all the way to Logan Square for Mexican food I actually liked. Taco Palace is not only better food - it's a better price!  Ridiculously fast service, best prices around and delicious food!!!
Their bean tostadas are amazing!!! Great prices, so reliable and friendly environment. Love this place for a quick dinner or lunch. Highly recommended for authentic Mexican.

Méxican guys operate this place, so one would assume they would get it right. And you know what, they did! Not an elegant place .... not even close ... but the food is awesome and the service is quick, especially considering the throngs of people in there on the Saturday night of pride weekend in this 'hood. Tacos, burritos and rice/beans! Nothing fancy. Just simple on-point Mexican food served up with some manners and a smile by a friendly bunch of guys from Guadalajara. Caramba!

Steak fajita burrito was cheesy, hot, and delicious. They wrap the burrito and put it back on the grill to give the tortilla a soft yet flakey exterior. I also got chips and guacamole. The chips were warm and flakey, that homemade style that's really good. The guac lacked flavor, but overall a pretty good experience.
Good first experience. Taco plate was excellent as was the beans and rice, chips and homemade salsa. Will definitely be back. Very inexpensive and good size portions.

Any time I want some good Mexican food, this is where I go. I've had probably half the menu so far and I still can't pick a favorite. Their guacamole is extremely good and the tortas are so filling. Even busy the food comes out pretty fast and their prices are pretty unbeatable. If you're looking for a place with top notch burritos or a whole bunch of tacos, this is it. I've been here so many times and most of the time completely sober, that's how I know this stuff is good.

Hungry late night in Boystown? Stop here!  Good Mexican food at great prices. It's right on the strip and it's quick and open late! The folks in here are friendly, and the food is nicely authentic. I'd recommend this as a top option for late night eating, but wouldn't limit it to just that. Stop in anytime!

I love this place and have eaten here many times.  The atmosphere is non-existent... but the food is very good for the price.  And as often as it has been reviewed as "drunk food"... I don't drink, so I've only ever tasted it sober.  Sure, it's not gourmet... but it's simple and fresh and yummy. Of all the things I've ever ordered there, it all tasted delicious EXCEPT for the 3 corn chips on my dinner place tonight.  They happened to be a bit off...  but the beans, rice, and those beloved enchiladas (and I've had 'em stuffed with cheese, chicken and beef over the years) are always just right. If you can handle the place looking like a dive, you might fall in love with it, as I have.
This is the best Mexican food in the city. Make sure you order the tacos with cilantro and onion for the best tacos youll ever have

So close to me that its inconvenient to go anywhere else for tacos. It so dive-y but the tacos are good enough for the price. If your looking for that gem hole in the wall, this is not it but it gets the job done and the people are friendly.  They are kind of stingy with their salsa.

Pros: fast, great service! The food is good. I love their steak tacos with just onions and cilantro.Their salsas are great too. prices are fair for the quality and portion.  Con: the place itself is a bit outdated and dingy but I guess that's expected for a fast food joint.
The best burrito place in lakeview. I always order their steak burrito and fish  taco.cheap ,fast and friendly!

This place can get very interesting at 3am on a Saturday. That's also the time the only time the food actually tastes good bc everyone is drunk. After seeing the methods of food prep or lack there of I now avoid coming here. However awful the food is you will definitely get a good laugh. If not because of the works then the crazy patrons
My go to late night spot in Lakeview or Lincoln Park.  Best Burritos around with fast and friendly service.  Expect it to be busy on a Saturday or Friday but you still won't wait long for your food.

This place was delicious! I got the special, which was enchiladas and avocado with a side of beans. It was done pretty quickly and the food was pretty good, super cheesy. Overall a good place to stop for a cheap and quick eat! :)

I was pleasantly surprised when my brother picked up an order from this random little Jem. I never expect much from taco places lately and this place has me wowed! Didn't have a single complaint, I've taken several people here recently thinking my first experience was a fluke and it had been both consistent and delicious. Hope the quality doesn't suddenly drop like so many places have done.

I lived in this neighborhood from '99 to '01 and would come here just about every weekend, or pretty much any night I went out drinking.  Sometimes, I would go out drinking just to justify a late night trip to the TBP. Flash forward 15 years, I'm old and tired and not drinking so much any more.  Stopped by (sober) the other night when I found myself in the neighborhood.  It's the same guys and the same DELICIOUS food.  I got the usual, junior ground beef burrito, and it was less than $5.  You can't beat it.  I can't wait to come back again and again.  I recall their nacho cheese sauce being legendary as well, I'll have to verify on my next visit :) Those complaining about atmosphere are hilarious!  It's a taco joint open 'til 2am, you want tablecloths and a wine list?

The place is a staple on the Halsted strip for late night bites.  The food will hit the spot after a night of drinking and soak up some of the damage you've done.  The staff, which has been around forever and doesn't seem to turnover, has an impeccable ability to interpret drunk speak, too.

Your search for the perfect Mexican food can finally cease. Taco and Burrito Palace is not only fresh but the food is wonderful quality for a VERY low price. My personal favorite is the carne asada quesadilla. Fresh avocado is the perfect addition on these quesadillas.  This place is open late, has fast service and above all, has the some of the nicest employees. Every time I have dined or taken out food from Taco and Burrito the staff treats me like a friend. It is quite refreshing.  The salsa is amazing, spicy and refreshing. No need to overpay for Mexican food any longer! Quality kind service awaits you at this hole in the wall joint.

Pretty good tacos. I had the al pastor.  Decent but I've had better. The meat was good but they lost a star because the tortillas had a funny taste and I thought they should have been cooked more. Also the restaurant had a funny smell. I didn't mind it but don't see myself coming back unless I'm out and it's the only place open.

This place is excellent if you accept it for what it is. It's great place for quick, cheap Mexican food on the go or for a quick dive. Considering how busy it gets at drunk thirty or during street fests, the guys that work there still manage to be very quick and whatever I order is always cheaper than expected.

Nice small little hole in the wall joint.  This place is the best for a quick meal and take-out. It's not fancy, but the food was always great. A lot of the workers were super friendly, and always up for conversation. You can't go wrong with the carne asada burrito, and their quesadillas. Nothing was expensive, you could get enough food to feed two people for under $10 bucks and still have leftovers for the next day. This place is open late, and sometimes it's great to sit at and people watch. It's usually never empty, but the food never takes long. Everything is made fresh to order.
The place is small but the food and customer service are great and fast. I would recommend this place if you want authentic Mexican food and you can't go wrong with a fatty burrito!
I mostly eat here for lunch or a family dinner.  (Not many 2am visits anymore).  I love their al pastor and chorizo tacos, and their sopes are to die for!

I dream of this place! If you can't get to Pilsen to get some good mexican food--this is the place!  Open late, clean, fast service, amazing salsa and wonderful staff, and cheap! Not to mention, damn good comida de mexicana!  My favorite thing is the steak chimichanga! Oh my sweet baby Jesus is it delicious. And the fellas are always so nice to give extra chips and salsa. Come in and feast. U won't regret the calorie overload of pure deliciousness!

The best place to get drunk food in Boystown. I would probably go during the day too. Love the half-size burritos and delicious tortas! I'm from the east coast and used to crave pizza when I was out, but now I am a taco addict.
Eh I've had better street tacos in Washington. I got the taco dinner, carne asada and it was super bland and disappointing. Being new to Chicago I'll have to keep searching for a good Mexican place.

This is drunk food, pure and simple. Do people come here sober? I vaguely recall that I may have once or twice, in my youth. It's a bit dingy, a bit grimy. The service is functional. There can be a long line at times (like when the bars are closing) but it usually moves pretty quick. The food actually tastes pretty good. But what that food did to my poor little tummy last time I went there was not. Let's just say I had a one-sided conversation with a certain porcelain god about it later that night.

I can't think of any better praise to heap on this place than to tell you during my apartment hunt, I refused to move more than five blocks from this emporium of late-night Mexican delights.  These literally are the finest tacos I've ever eaten - simple, perfectly made, with delicious proteins, crispy fine-cut lettuce, juicy tomato, subtle taco sauce, and perfect sour cream. As I branch out into the other stuff on the menu, I can say it's all just as amazing. For less than you tipped at your Lincoln Park brasserie earlier in the night (under $2 a pop) you can stuff yourself well into the next evening on a 2am taco binge. Plus, you get the company of the two or three guys who seem to always be on duty and can be genuinely hilarious, particularly if you speak a little Spanish. Some may call it a dive joint, but the term is almost a discredit to the little shop. Everything is clean, friendly, and fast -- just not exactly over-decorated. Unless, of course, you count the massive animated neon sign out front. I'd hate to have an apartment on the same block as that mother.  If you're ever around Boystown, Wrigleyville, or Lakeview, do yourself and your friends a favor and stop by for a bite. Especially if it's after a great night out.

Good prices, but they need to hide the sour cream dispenser.  Tried a vegetarian burrito, and aside from concluding that, yes, there is no meat in here, I could not identify any vegetables except for lettuce and tomatoes.  If sour cream is a vegetable, then yes, there was definitely some of that.  The burrito was reminiscent of a Taco Bell seven-layer burrito, but with one layer:  sour cream.

This place is PURE HEAVEN! I've been going for 12 years now, their food is authentic, and not to mention, incredibly yummy! The ingredients are fresh and they're quite cheap. Being vegetarian, I'm usually stuck with some lettuce in a piece of tortilla, but Burrito Palace has some HUGE and FILLING burritos, even the Vegetarian burrito that is my "usual." I'm drooling right now just thinking about it :) As I said, I've been eating there for about 12 years, and the two guys there are SO friendly and their customer service is impeccable. If you want a very relaxed and chill place to get delicious Mexican food in Wrigleyville, this is the place to go.

Good, solid, cheap Mexican food. I've tried their chicken and beef tacos, chicken and beef nachos, burritos and their chicken enchiladas, all very good!  It's close to my boyfriend's apartment so whenever I'm in the hood I make sure to stop by.

What Chicago lacks in worthwhile Chinese restaurants it more than makes up for in late night Mexican spots.  Most every Mexican corner joint has their strengths and their weaknesses (some do steak better, some do pork better, some do burritos better, some do tacos better, etc.) and this place's strengths (pork tacos and the burrito suizo) happen to be my weakness if you get what I'm saying. The prices are right, the service is relatively friendly and speedy, and like I said, they're open very late -- later than almost every other eating establishment in the area.  Give this place a shot regardless of whether you're sober or less than.  And if it's a steamy summer evening make sure you order a large (h)orchata for the road.

Awesome burritos? Check. Cooked fresh? Check. Open almost 24 hours a day and calls to you like a siren when you're drunk and hangry? Double-check! The restaurant is small and not fancy by any means, but that doesn't mean the 3 guys I see working there (every time I go be it 2 PM or 2 AM) don't whip up quick and pretty awesome mexican food...and jokes from time to time depending on who's acting a fool in front of them. Not to mention the prices are cheap, so you can totally go home full of sopes or tacos for about $5. If you want some entertainment the best time to go is around 3 AM on a Friday or Saturday night. I'm addicted to the avocado burrito and care asada quesadilla.

My rating of 3 stars might be a tad misleading.  I think the food is 4 or 5 stars... but the dive-atmosphere gets 2 stars. So, if you don't mind the way the place looks/feels... the food is worth the experience. A friend of mine who visits several times a year (and stays at a nearby bed & breakfast) would be perfectly happy to eat ALL his meals at the Taco & Burrito Palace.

Um - really what can I say? Its a sunny day and you want a quick meal - this is your place!! You are on your way out to drink and need something in your tummy - this is your place!! You have been drinking all night and want that spicy taco goodness - this is your place!! You just dont wanna cook and want cheap, tasty Mexican food - this is your place! After 2 years of living nearby I have eaten here dozens of times and it is great!  Cheap, large portions, friendly guys (who put up with some crazy drunks) who are open late, have a clean place and take credit cards when you are out of cash! ENJOY your tacos!  Cheers!

Went here for the first time tonight. Had a small burrito meal with pork, steak taco, and guacamole. Everything was great and the staff is very friendly. The atmosphere is just right for a Mexican place. The steak wasn't the best but the pork is very greasy and good. Very good guacamole too. The prices are great and I will be back.

OMG! This was good, thanks to the locals and others who wrote about this place. I was in the area and hungry so I stopped in. Fast, flavorful, and cheap is the best way to describe it; for a little less than you spend on a burrito at chipotle I even got a medium drink and could've have an order of onion rings or fries, but I didn't get them cause I more likely wouldn't eat them, but that's how cheap this place is. I was so tempted to get a burrito to go.

I had a steak torta and it was good! The steak was a little on the dry side but it hit the spot after a late night of partying and drinking! Love that it's open late and relatively cheap. $5 minimum for debit/credit card so bring cash if you can! Downside: Not many tables and a little on the dingy side.
This is the only fast late night Mexican places that doesn't send me to porcelain throne in the AM.... and it's tasty!

Chicken tacos are awesome, except when I had a bone in mine. The hamburgers suck. Veggies tacos are amazing- Filling as well! Beef and steak tacos are dry and over cooked. The steak torta, was pretty good, but again the steak is always over cooked. The tortillas are not homemade, store bought...nothing great. Oh... Rice needs work to...also very dry Most consistent are the veggie tacos (my g/f loves) They get a 5/5 Descent drunk food though

My go-to place to grab some tacos when on Halsted. If i remember correctly, me and a few friends bought 11+ tacos to fill ourselves up after Pride. It's pretty darn good. Probably one of the better places to eat a taco near boystown. Tacos and others are affordable, horchata tastes good. Its great when you're wasted.

Well, if it was 3 AM and I had been drinking, I may have liked this place a little better. The good- cheap, good corn tortilla, good sized portions, chicken meat was fresh tasting, service at counter was fast and kind. Bad- HOT during the lunch hour on a warm day, ambiance is non existing. It's a taco joint. Get it?

BURRITOS MOTHERF*CKER, DO YOU EAT EM? Cheap, fast, tasty. Nothing mind numbing, but definitely worth the money! Also, they offer JR. sized burritos as well as large, which are a bargain and still pretty huge.

This place is amazing!  It's always best at night if you want fun, loud company. If you're in a hurry and really hungry come in during daytime. Their pork tacos are to die for! the cooks really know what they're doing. Best after a night out and you want something to just really hit the spot. This has never been a miss for me.  4 stars because the place is a bit small and it gets really crowded at night.

Pork Tacos. Go here and have one (or four).  These guys are authentic (and very, very affordable). Cilantro, onions, lime wedge...the quintessentially authentic taco. And muy sabroso, might I add.  Hole in the wall atmosphere and good for late night cravings - but its perfectly fine to visit during normal hours (i.e. *not* trashy). Salud!

After leaving the Big Hair Ball @ Hydrate, I decided I wanted to get a bite to eat.  So, as we were walking by this place, I decided to go in as it has been a very long time since eating there. I ordered a torta with Chorizo with no tomato or lettuce.  Over all it was tasty. My only recollection of this place is only when I am half in the bag.  Otherwise, I don't think I've tried completely sober.  LOL!!

I simply ADORE Taco & Burrito Palace.  There is nothing I crave more when leaving a bar or house party late at night than their chicken tacos!  Everything on the menu is a winner, I must say. I always really enjoy the service I get too. I can't recall a time when I've gone in and haven't enjoyed a conversation with someone behind the counter. The guys are always in good spirits and ready to joke around a bit. Argh. Now I'm getting a craving.
best cheap taco place in boys town! im such a regular here!

Hands down, the best vegetarian tacos I have EVER had!  It's a hole in the wall type of place - but it has amazingly good food at cheap prices.  You will walk away stuffed, not only in your belly, but also in your wallet.  I just wish they were in San Francisco!
You may get emotional here after a night out.  In fact, this place deserves 10 stars at 3am in the morning, which is typically when I am there.   Sober - well lets say 2 to 3 stars is about right.

This place is the best for some good mexican food. Coming from LA, it was a huge reminder of the food there. I ordered the carne asada burrito. It was really good and very inexpensive. Perhaps I was drunk, but I spoke to the employees here in Spanish which was great. Most of their business probably comes from the people stumbling in after the clubs and bars in Boystown.

This is one of my favorite carryout places.  Best inexpensive Mexican food around.  Every time I go in there is someone talking how much the love the food here.  I've tried  most of the items on the menu but love their vegetarian burritos with avocado. This is a great place for cheap, quick, yummy Mexican food.

This place is fantastic. Under $2 for a very filling taco (two tacos is about the equivalent of half a chipotle burrito) The place, while it appears outdated, is actually clean and the food is delicious. I probably go here every other Saturday for lunch.

Okay so I am not sure when the first time was that I stumbled (literally) into Taco & Burrito Palace but I think it was somewhere around 3 years ago.  I have stumbled and walked soberly into TBP many times since!  I absolutely love this place!  Every time I walk in there is a loud resounding "Maaaaayyyylllleeeeessssaaaa" from all of the guys that work here!  I love them and they love me.  I'm not quite sure if it because of my great personality or my large 'assets' but either way they always make me a killer burrito!  The first time I entered here sober I was very scared that the food was not going to live up to its drunken amazingness.  But was I sooo wrong! I eat here often while sober!  The nachos w chorizo are so yummy and I love the burritos.  I have to order the Junior Burrito because I would never be able to finish the regular size.  I would definitely recommend this place if you are in Boystown and need a quick mexican fix or if you are stumbling out of Scarlet and need something to save you from calling in sick in the morning!  Either way its a great hole in the wall joint!!

I love this little hole in the wall place. The guys who work behind the counter are always pleasant and the food is awesome! This place is cheap, cheap,cheap but tasty. The guacamole is always a winner. I am a vegetarian and they have a lot of options. I get the vegi burrito all the time. I have been very pleased every time eat here.

chorizo, egg & tortilla after Jäger and beer is an experience that few remember.  In my moment of clarity I distinctly remember mumbling, "wow thi is gud" (translate, wow this is good) as I shoved the burrito in my mouth.
GREAT food! SUPER friendly staff!  They are open for breakfast and stay open late. Everything from the breakfast burrito to the enchiladas are amazing! Definitely try the chorizo tacos!

Don't let the run down appearance and handmade menu boards fool you, this place has the best Mexican food in the area and has spared me a hangover after a night on Halsted many a time.  TBP has the standard Mexican fare; nothing is particularly standout because I've never really had anything bad there. I'll generally get something with chicken or carne asada, both of which are cooked and seasoned very well. Everything is cooked to order and ingredients are usually very fresh. Portions are fairly generous considering most everything is priced between $2-$7. And the best part is the food tastes good while sober also. It's also an interesting place to people watch late on a Friday or Saturday; you get anything from drunk college kids to drag queens to leather daddies wandering through. Always entertaining. The cooks are amazing, patient, and get your order out as fast as they can... somehow it's always the same exact staff working no matter when I go, day or night. TBP definitely isn't fine dining but it's a great place to stop by if you're too lazy to make dinner or need something to take the edge of a binge drinking spree.

Full credit to the late night counter guy for keeping an even keel amid a sea of preposterous clowns stumbling through their orders. But the vegetarian burrito I had was weak.  Was 90% lettuce and cheese. Bonus - the bathroom in the back is not nearly as horrifying as you might expect.

This place makes a mean Torta, and a good burrito. The service is great and they always greet you with a smile and get your food out hot, fresh, and fast. They are veterans at putting up with drunks too, so I don't think you can do anything that will seriously anger the guy behind the counter at this point. Also somehow there is always a soccer (futbol?) game playing on the TV. Definitely a favorite mexican place in the area.

This is one of the premier late-night food spots in Boystown. Yes, it shines as a great place for drunk food, but it's perfect for grabbing that little-bit-of-sumthin' before you go out for the night (aka light dinner). The atmosphere is simple but warm. The guys at the counter usually efficient but nice, and they usually remember that I like to take the bottle of salsa verde to my table. I'm personally partial to chicken tostatas, but I've sampled much on the menu, and nothing has disappointed. For what this place attempts to be, they definitely get right.

The cheap prices is what allows this to have such a high rating.  The food is always fresh and flavorful.  No, it's not fine dining, but it's the perfect place to grab a bite after sports or a bar night.  Quesadillas are the best around - the cheese is so buttery it drips!

Don't judge a book by its cover!  The food here is quite tasty.  The price is right,  The service is friendly and quick.  It makes for great drunk food, but really, it's great anytime of day, sober or not. I usually have a burrito, but my friends have had dinner platters, which never disappoint.  Nothing fancy here, but that's quite fine by me!

Back up to 5 stars. I finally tried a chicken burrito and well, it saved me from myself. Yes, it was late and I was slightly tipsy (hey, I'm a lady... we don't get 'drunk'!) but being a discerning burrito maven, I know quality when I get my hands on it. Unlike most taquerias, they use all white meat chicken. It's softly shredded, juicy and all-around delicious. Add avocado and you've got yourself one bad-ass burrito. Whether it's been 6 weeks or 6 months, these guys always remember me. Thanks, friends!
Best mexican fast food at an amazing price. Can't go wrong with the tacos or burritos. Guess that's why they call it the Palace!

This was my first place to eat in Chicago that wasn't a chain place and its pretty darn good, went in the afternoon so the food was very fresh, reasonable priced and refillable horchata! Reading some other reviews...burritos are not required to come with rice, I don't care if they do that in Cali or Texas or even Az...if you want that crap then Chipoltle is just down the street....the food here is honest, straightforward, and modestly priced with a few nods to americana.

Druuuunk foooooood!!! I love a good drunk food taco and the Burrito Palace does not disappoint!  I must admit, I'm still a little tipsy, even after the feast I just ate at the Burrito Palace. Two al pastor tacos with rice and beans...plus a side of chips and guacamole for the table. Sheesh! I'm stuffed! And it all cost $10. C.H.E.A.P. Delicious.

Sweet minty jeebus, am I glad TBP is right around the corner from me.  Another N. Halsted Market Days has gone....maybe since I live close, I allowed myself to take too many liberties with the Bacardi Lemonades. So before limping back to my apartment (the beautiful shirtless gay men had me dancing outside of Hydrate for HOURS)  I decided I needed to pick up an aftercare emergency kit.  Aftercare emergency kit = Gatorade and carbohydrates. I don't DO hangovers.  Already had the gatorade, so now I needed the food. And there it was...TBP. Their burrito was greasy....but not seep through the bag greasy, so it's probably not the greasiest you'll ever encounter. It was cheap, fast (given the crowd) and most importantly...it was good!  And I'm pretty sober by this point, so you can take my word on that.

This place is a little piece of heaven for anyone in Lakeview who grew up in Southern California because it's about as close as you can get to genuine Mexican food within walking distance.  The key is sticking to the basics.  If you order tacos just get it with: cilantro, onions, lime, and salsa.  No need for anything else. Trust me. Their taco dinner (al pastor and carne asada) is always just what I need to get my stomach back in check after a hard night of drinking, and it's deliciously amazing every single time.  In fact, whenever my friends and I finish our night at T&B, I can't help but say how "This was the best idea ever!" Also, they're always open when I need them.  Doesn't matter what time of day.  If you have a craving for a carne asada burrito at 8am on a Saturday morning, they're always there to satisfy it.
If you're on halsted until Sidetrack closes, you should probably just go and get the Al Pastor Burrito + avocado. Maybe wait until  you are less likely to show your al pastor panza at the beach, tho.
Food was great; the guys were friendly and nice; and got a good meal for $7.  Good for people-watching if you sit in the window.  Can't complain -- will be back.

What kind of burrito does not have rice in it? Yeah, coming from California, I don't get it...  The funny thing is that I saw an episode of a show where a critic helped revitalize a failing restaurant that morning and so I have to give them props for not microwaving their food. These are not frozen food that are just reheated there for consumption.

This place has some of the best, and cheapest burritos I've had in the city. I used to live down the street and I would go here at least once a week. I'm sad I moved away from there now, there's no place to find an excellent burrito by my new place. Their tortas are also fantastic. I prefer the steak, but everything else is great. Excellent late night food, but it does get extremely busy as everyone is leaving th bars.

Went here for a late breakfast and had a steak burrito with guac. The tortilla leaves a little to be desired but it was filling and actually really good. Only cost me 6.50 with the guac so pretty cheap. Great quick place to go near (or in?) boys town.
This is definitely my go to place for late night snacks or that late morning meal when breakfast is over. Their guacamole is fantastic and the staff is really nice.

Yes, we are fans. We frequent this place quite often, for quick, cheap fulfilling Mexican food. Weather late night, or early afternoon, this place is our go-to guy in the fourth quarter, our fail-safe when we don't feel like spending $30 on a dinner at Las Mananitas.  Instead, we walk a few store fronts down, and drop $13 on a Carne Asada Fajita Burrito with avocado, two ground beef tacos, no tomatoes, with a side of chips and avacado. Avacado is nice and fresh, and a small size is efficiant for two chip-dippers. Warning: though the burrito is nice and tasty, this burrito will fall apart on you. Its a juicy one. If you eat your burritos in the foil, perhaps you will have better luck, but that's just not my thing. We keep going back to this place for a few reasons. It's fast (8-10 minute wait if the place is empty), close, convenient, and affordable (average tab is $12-$14 depending of if we get horchata), and they will continue to help us out when we are in a dinner choice bind.  Intoxicated or not.
If it's between the hours of 1am - 5am and your hammered and need some food.. this is a great place. Best burrito in the place is the steak fajita burrito.

Used to live across the street from this place and hasthe  best after the bar food around.  Actually pretty damned good food when sober as well.  Im glad I dont live close  anymore as I would have an enormous gut.  As a straight dude would kinda freak my homophobe friends out at 3am, but whatever.  had to come back and edit.  I forgot. of course you tip these guys as their cool, serving cheap good food and they deserve and appreciate it.

Surprisingly good for a hole in the wall spot. I think places with convenience like this could get away with serving a lot of bad food to drunks and gay tourists who don't know better. Tacos and burritos +.

I actually don't know if this place is any good. But it sure seems that way. My rational is that I have never dined here when not heavily intoxicated. It sure seems good though. I recommend the el pastor tacos and burritos. For the later, I'd make sure to skip the beans. That just doesn't seem necessary. Typically I like these things made the mexican way with just onion and cilantro, but you're going to get the americanized version here. Again, I'd limit the toppings to lettuce and tomato. Maybe one day I'll swing buy when sober, but probably not. In short, it can't be beat for the late night cravings.

Great place for late night food. I usually get chicken tacos, and they always satisfy. It's a place to go when you need to grab a quick bite to eat before, during, or after going out in the neighborhood.

Despite my last review. I keep going back in a drunken stupor. When you have had a few drinks too many in Boystown and want to grab something to soak up the booze, this is my go-to spot. But, I usually end up with indigestion in the middle of the night from it...not pretty...

This place is just right around the corner from my apartment so I was really hoping that I would like it. The place is very small and not the nicest of ambiance but that doesn't matter. The couple of guys how are working are really nice. You don't have to wait long at all for your order and they have never made a mistake. Their prices are pretty cheap and you get plenty of food for what you pay. My favorites are the avocado and the steak burrito.

All right. A couple of real women watching boys dressed as real women, and then shaking their real women asses work up a powerful hunger. Just thinking about the makeup application at a drag show makes me tired. And slightly jealous, yet in awe, of all that glitter eye shadow.  What's that got to do with the T&BP? Nothing. But I had to do something to work off the calories to make a late night burrito acceptable. Great little joint for a latenight bite. The Jr. Burrito was the perfect amount of food, and for $3.99 - hello, bargain. The Carne Asada was juicy and delicious, and the tortilla was crispy. Loved the green salsa - my girl CB said it was a bit hot - me, I LIKE it hot. This is not one of those burritoes that is jammed with a bunch of other crap to enlarge it. No rice, beans, lettuce, tomato or sour cream (though you can get the crap if you want). Just JUICY MEAT, baby. Really, what more do you need at 2 AM? Well, yes, I know, but you are on your own for that. I'd come here during the day! Okay, how's that for a good review! It's a bare bones Mexican joint, filled with drunk people late at night. The guys behind the counter are sweet as pie, and will let you use the bathroom if you ask nicely. If you're down with that, T&BP is your joint.

Unfortunately, I am not a big fan. And most of it doesn't have to do with the food ironically. BUT reviews are about food and service and ambiance so here we go. I have been a few times & I don't really have complaints about the taco's. But what stands out & makes me write this review is the atmosphere inside.  The staff... mostly the two guys who work the joint all the time definitely make a woman feel a bit awkward. I understand the location can provoke certain behaviors but it got a bit out of hand. I gave them the benefit of the doubt (possibly a fight with their wifes?) but it happened every time I would go in. Their gawking & under their breath comments made me feel pretty uncomfortable & the last straw was when they mentioned being able to deliver food when I didn't even ask for it & it was pushed each time afterwards! It has gotten to the point where I won't be going there again. It is a shame because I was a frequent customer - and convenience couldn't have been better. Food - 4. Service/Ambiance - 0. Not good behavior boys...

I was walking down Halsted with some friends, looking for a quick, cheap bite to eat. We came across the Taco and Burrito Palace expecting mediocre tacos and some chips. While the service was fast, the food was delicious. The tacos steak and chicken tacos were cheap and tasty, as well as the guac with chips. Really great when you want to eat cheap without sacrificing flavor!

This place is absolutely my favorite hole in the wall Mexican place.  I usually get the avocado burrito, which is delicious.  The junior is plenty big for me, and I always ask for the salsa verde to make it nice and spicy.  Their enchiladas are also great, as are the quesadillas.  The staff is also really nice.   If you're looking for a tablecloth Mexican restaurant, I wouldn't come here.  But hey, tacos are street food, and they aren't meant to be eaten on tablecloths anyway.
I'm Mexican And these tacos take me back to mom's cookin' I love it.

I love this place so much. It is sooo inexpensive and the food is always so good. They absolutely set the standard for what a steak taco should be. Great quality meat with no fat, generous cheese and fresh lettuce and tomoato - simple and good. The guys that run the place are really friendly and I would go again and again.
Awesome steak quesadillas.  They have that authentic white cheese that is sort of salty that makes all the difference.

How can you not love this place?  I've only been in here between the hours of midnight and 5am, yet never been yelled at or thrown out.  Such gentlemen. Honestly, I've tried countless other Mexican places late at night closer to my house, and this one is HANDS DOWN the best for what I want.  I would fall over and die right now for their chicken and guac quesadillas.  Whatever they do, they just taste better than anyone else.  Not soggy, not all soft.  Nice and crispy with a good amount of chicken.

Firstly its a 2 block walk from my apartment. They're open late and they've never messed up an order. Its right by the Halsted number 8 stop at Cornelia which makes it real convenient. The al pastor tacos and burritos are very tasty and a little greasy . But sometimes greasy is  what you need. They do take all major credit cards and its cheap to begin with. Unlike when I order from other places they give a lot meat in the tacos and burritos and its all meat not chunks of meat, fat , and gristle. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area and are in the mood for Mexican.

Every time I eat here I end up feeling a little worse.  Granted, I eat here after drinking . . .  In all fairness, it's open late and has a wide variety of food.  Just beware of using it too often as your midnight booze-blotter.

please take warning that this is not a substitute for taco bell. it is an entirely different and wonderful experience (please note that i do adore taco bell...hello burrito supreme, but there is a time and a place for TB, as there is a place for TBP).  my roommate and i came here after the 100 drag queens around the world show at sidetrack for drunk munchies and it was actually pretty amazing. the restaurant is by no standards a palace (their bathroom is vile), the food is great!! and cheap! we spent under $6 for 2 quesadillas and sodas for delicious food and great service (the staff is super nice...from what i remember haha). prices set for peasants at the TB palace. aaaamazzzing!  minus one star for the bathroom...because it was really really gross.
This place is wonderful. They have really great tacos al pastor. The best I've had in Chicago so far. They are also generous with the avocado when you add it to your order. This is also key.

This place looks super rundown from the outside, but it is suprisingly nice in the inside.  Nice by Mexican restaurant standards, that is.  The food was good too.  I had a chimichanga, I think my friend had tacos.  Pretty standard Mexican.  They have a nice tv with sports usually on which I don't care about but guys might.  Much better than I expected it would be.

Having been here a handful of times before we returned this weekend.  My day had been some what long as I attended the Cubs game and stopped into two bars on the way home.  Took a quick nappy nap and was ready for a friends bar tending shift at a bar down the street from here.  So can we all say shampoo affect?  Yep, a few cocktails and I was ripped again and starving. We headed over to TBP and ordered up so to go food.  I had a steak burrito which was packed full of steak, I did not expect the amount of steak they had in there.  My partner ordered a hamburger which he said was oddly good and they enchiladas which he said were excellent. Good place to grab some food and head home as the after effects spoken about in other reviews are very real.

This place is one of those kick-ass hole in the walls that only locals know about. Their rice is amazing--you won't really know what I mean until you try it. And the soft corn tortilla beef tacos...yumm! I haven't gone there in a long time (it was a place we went a lot after a night out in college a few years ago), but I have passed by it lately and thought, "I definitely need to hit that up again." If you like greasy, perfectly-spiced, inexpensive, and fairly authentic Mexican food *fast*, you should try this place out. Plus, it's really funny when your friends from out of town get pissed at you for a second when you say, "We're eating at the Taco Burrito Palace!" But then they'll get over it really fast when they try the food. =)

Right down the street from me, and I love it! Everythings fairly fresh, and the meat is pretty delicious. The al pastor is a little greasy, but the carne asada is divine! I've also seen the same shirtless black man that hangs out right in front of  the restaurant, at least three times now. I'm starting to wonder what he does all day, because I see him at all random hours. Anyway, the burritos are good, and the location is right in the middle of Halsted, which is great for people watching outside their window!

This place is awesome.  I have been going for 10+ years, generally after 2:00 a.m., and usually after one or two white winte spritzers.  Everything is always impeccable, but then I do tend to order in Spanish. "Un burrito grande con todo pa' llevar."  I have also had one or two nights when I have had. "Un hombre grande con todo pa' llevar".  hehehehe! The only problem is that you MUST leave the next morning free  to blow up with gas like Veruca Salt. But without the purple.

Love these guys - great for late nights, take outs, or eat ins when you need a shopping break.  I love hole in the wall looking places.  The guys are nice, the food is wonderful and you can't beat the prices!  Hangover cures on the menu here!!
My favorite burrito joint lakeview.  The restaurant smells like mildew but it's still worth the trip.

I've been going here for 16 some years and it never gets old.  You can't go wrong with anything that you get here.  The guacamole is always fresh and tasty.  And, as weird as it sounds, the Coca-Cola on tap is the shit!  I don't know...a lot of restaurant could learn from these guys and the harmony that TBP2 has found between syrup, carbonated water and ice.  It's the way Coke should taste.  Sure it's not fancy...but in my opinion Mexican food should be cheap and yummy.

Taco Burrito Palace, or TBP as i like to call it, is my favorite place to eat mexican food.  Granted, i'm very often intoxicated (or recovering from said intoxication) when i go there, but not always.   I love their steak tacos.  They are much more flavorful than most places.  Their avocado tortas and burritos are awesome as well. In fact whenever anyone I know wants to go to Cesars, i usually question why.  I tell them i can get a better burrito for half the price at TBP.   The only downside to TBP these days...they took out the bowling and photohunt machines.  It makes waiting for your food a lot less entertaining.  Make sure to tip the guys working behind the counter.  they are hard working guys and really appreciate it when you do!

Great drunken burrito experiences.  The veggie burrito is great and the chips and salsa do the trick.  As you can imagine, it is pretty ridiculous at 2am and there are a lot of drunks to make you feel right at home.

There's no place like Taco Burrito Palace when its 3am and you are craving a big meaty burrito.  This place seems to be open all the time (but I think it's open till 4am), and always hits the spot.  I've even tried the food here sober, and it's not bad.  The taco meal is a good bet if you're not feeling the burritos

What can I say - this place suppliments my kitchen when i get home and i am either too tired or its too late to cook.  I have been eating here the past 10 years and it has been consistently good.  The cooks have not changed too much over the years and they are always friendly!   Really good cheap mexican food.  I recommend the burritos, quesadillas, taco's, flauta's, enchiladas, torta's .... well everything...!

...an excellent place to stop by for some inexpensive, delicious tacos (& burritos, among other things).  The tacos de asada (steak) are my favorite. This is definitely a place to stop by on the way home from the bars.  Friendly, no-frills atmosphere

This is a great little Mexican place, especially because its in the heart of Wrigley so its a nice cheap place to go after you've been drinking a while!  Their burritos are a good size and the ingredients are fresh
